fields.accordion_info_text: This message is the in the info popup

fields.label: Ultrasound test
fields.label_info_text: An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation, or placenta location).

v_required.err: Please specify Ultrasound test
Please specify ultrasound not done

fields.hint: Specify any other reason why the ultrasound test was not done. *

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the ultrasound test was not done.

fields.hint: Date that the ultrasound was done.*

v_required.err: Date that the ultrasound was done.

fields.hint: Gestational age in weeks from ultrasound. *

v_required.err: Please specify the gestational age in weeks from ultrasound

fields.hint: Gestational age in days from ultrasound. *

v_required.err: Please specify the gestational age in days from ultrasound

fields.toaster_info_text: An early U/S is key to estimate gestational age, improve detection of fetal anomalies and multiple fetuses, reduce induction of labour for post-term pregnancy, and improve a womanâ€™s pregnancy experience.

fields.text: Number of fetuses detected during ultrasound.

fields.toaster_info_text: The use of aspirin after 12 weeks gestation is recommended as well as calcium if low dietary intake area. Please also provide counseling.

fields.label: Select preferred gestational age: Using LMP Using ultrasound Using SFH or abdominal palpation

v_required.err: Date that the blood test was done.

fields.toaster_info_text:
- Woman is at risk of alloimmunisation if the baby's father is Rh positive or unknown.

- Proceed with local protocol to investigate sensitization and the need for referral.

- If Rh negative and non-sensitized, woman should receive anti

- D prophylaxis postnatally if the baby is Rh positive.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why an HIV test was not done.

fields.text: HIV test inconclusive, refer for further testing.

fields.toaster_info_text:
- Refer for further testing and confirmation

- Refer for HIV services

- Advise on opportunistic infections and need to seek medical help

- Proceed with systematic screening for active TB

fields.text: Partner HIV test inconclusive, refer partner for further testing.

fields.toaster_info_text:
Provide comprehensive HIV prevention options: 

- STI screening and treatment (syndromic and syphilis)

- Condom promotion

- Risk reduction counselling

- PrEP with emphasis on adherence

- Emphasize importance of follow-up ANC contact visits

fields.label: Hepatitis B test
fields.label_info_text: In settings where the proportion of HBsAg seroprevalence in the general population is 2% or higher or in settings where there is a national Hep B ANC routine screening program in place, or if the woman is HIV positive, injects drugs, or is a sex worker, then Hep B testing is recommended if the woman is not fully vaccinated against Hep B.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the Hep B test was not done.

fields.toaster_info_text: Counselling and referral required.
Hep B vaccination required anytime after 12 weeks gestation.

fields.label: Hepatitis C test
fields.label_info_text: In settings where the proportion of HCV antibody seroprevalence in the general population is 2% or higher, or the woman is HIV positive, injects drugs, or is a sex worker, then a Hep C test is required.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the Hep C test was not done.
Select the date of the Hepatitis C test.

fields.label: Hep C test type
fields.label_info_text: Anti-HCV laboratory-based immunoassay is the preferred method for testing for Hep C infection in pregnancy. If immunoassay is not available, Anti-HCV rapid diagnostic test (RDT) is recommended over Dried Blood Spot (DBS) Anti-HCV testing.

fields.label: Syphilis test
fields.label_info_text: A syphilis test is recommended for all pregnant women at the first contact and again at the first contact of 3rd trimester (28 weeks). Women who are already confirmed positive for syphilis do not need to be tested.

fields.text: This area has a high prevalence of syphilis (5% or greater).
fields.toaster_info_text: Use an on-site rapid syphilis test (RST), and, if positive, provide the first dose of treatment. Then refer the woman for a rapid plasma reagin (RPR) test. If the RPR test is positive, provide treatment according to the clinical phase of syphilis.
fields.toaster_info_title: This area has a high prevalence of syphilis (5% or greater).

fields.text: This area has a low prevalence of syphilis (below 5%)
fields.toaster_info_text: On-site rapid syphilis test (RST) should be used to test pregnant women for syphilis.
fields.toaster_info_title: This area has a low prevalence of syphilis (below 5%)

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the syphilis test was not done
Select the date of the syphilis test.

fields.toaster_info_text: Provide counselling and treatment according to protocol.

fields.label: Urine test
fields.label_info_text: A urine test is required at the first contact, last contact in 2nd trimester, and 2nd contact in 3rd trimester OR anytime the woman reports pain during urination (dysuria). A dipstick test is required if the woman has a repeat high BP reading (140/90 or higher). Otherwise, a urine test is optional. The urine test checks for bacterial or other infections that can lead to adverse outcomes for the neonate. The urine dipstick test can check for proteins in the urine, which can be a sign of pre-eclampsia.

v_required.err: Specify the other reason the urine test was not done.
Select the date of the urine test..

fields.label: Urine test type
fields.label_info_text: A urine test is required at the first contact, last contact in 2nd trimester, and 2nd contact in 3rd trimester OR anytime the woman reports pain during urination (dysuria). A dipstick test is required if the woman has a repeat high BP reading (140/90 or higher). Otherwise, a urine test is optional. The urine test checks for bacterial or other infections that can lead to adverse outcomes for the neonate. The urine dipstick test can check for proteins in the urine, which can be a sign of pre-eclampsia.

fields.toaster_info_text:
Please provide appropriate counseling for GDM risk mitigation, including:

 - Reasserting dietary interventions

- Reasserting physical activity during pregnancy

fields.text: Seven-day antibiotic regimen for asymptomatic bacteriuria (ASB)
fields.toaster_info_text:
A woman is considered to have ASB if she has one of the following test results:

 - Positive culture (> 100,000 bacteria/mL)

- Gram-staining positive

- Urine dipstick test positive (nitrites or leukocytes)

Seven-day antibiotic regimen is recommended for all pregnant women with asymptomatic bacteriuria (ASB) to prevent persistent bacteriuria, preterm birth and low birth weight.
fields.toaster_info_title: Seven-day antibiotic regimen for asymptomatic bacteriuria (ASB)

fields.text: Intrapartum antibiotic to prevent early neonatal Group B Streptococcus (GBS) infection counseling
fields.toaster_info_text: Pregnant women with Group B Streptococcus (GBS) colonization should receive intrapartum antibiotic administration to prevent early neonatal GBS infection.
fields.toaster_info_title: Intrapartum antibiotic to prevent early neonatal Group B Streptococcus (GBS) infection counseling

fields.toaster_info_text:
The woman has Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (GDM) if her fasting plasma glucose is 92â€“125 mg/dL. 

OR

- 75g OGTT - fasting glucose 92â€“125 mg/dL

- 75g OGTT - 1 hr 180â€“199 mg/dL

- 75g OGTT - 2 hrs 153â€“199 mg/dL

The woman has Diabetes Mellitus (DM) in pregnancy if her fasting plasma glucose is 126 mg/dL or higher.

OR

- 75g OGTT - fasting glucose 126 mg/dL or higher

- 75g OGTT - 1 hr 200 mg/dL or higher

- 75g OGTT - 2 hrs 200 mg/dL or higher

- Random plasma glucose 200 mg/dL or higher

fields.text: Dietary intervention recommended and referral to high level care.
fields.toaster_info_text: Woman with hyperglycemia - Recommend dietary intervention and refer to higher level care.
fields.toaster_info_title: Dietary intervention recommended and referral to high level care.

fields.label: Blood haemoglobin test
fields.label_info_text: Blood haemoglobin testing is necessary for diagnosing anaemia in pregnancy.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the blood haemoglobin test
Select the date of the blood haemoglobin test.

fields.label: Blood haemoglobin test type
fields.label_info_text: Complete blood count test is the preferred method for testing for anaemia in pregnancy. If complete blood count test is not available, haemoglobinometer is recommended over haemoglobin colour scale.

v_min.err: The complete blood count test must be greater than 0

v_max.err: The complete blood count test must be les than 500

v_required.err: Complete blood count test result (g/dl)

v_min.err: The Hb test result - haemoglobinometer (g/dl) must be greater than 0

v_max.err: The Hb test result - haemoglobinometer (g/dl) must be les than 25

v_required.err: Enter Hb test result - haemoglobinometer (g/dl)

fields.hint: Hb test result - haemoglobin colour scale (g/dl) *

v_min.err: The Hb test result - haemoglobin colour scale (g/dl) must be greater than 0

v_max.err: The Hb test result - haemoglobin colour scale (g/dl) must be les than 25

v_required.err: Enter Hb test result - haemoglobin colour scale (g/dl)

fields.toaster_info_text:
Anaemia - Hb level of < 11 in first or third trimester or Hb level < 10.5 in second trimester.

OR

No Hb test results recorded, but woman has pallor.

v_required.err: Enter the Hematocrit value

fields.toaster_info_text: Hemotacrit levels less than 10.5.

v_required.err: Enter the White blood cell (WBC) count

fields.text: White blood cell count too high!
fields.toaster_info_text: White blood cell count above 16,000.
fields.toaster_info_title: White blood cell count too high!

v_required.err: Enter the Platelet count value

fields.toaster_info_text: Platelet count under 100,000.

fields.label: TB screening
fields.label_info_text: In settings where the tuberculosis (TB) prevalence in the general population is 100/100,000 persons or higher or in settings with sub-populations that have very poor access to health care, or if the woman is HIV positive, TB screening is recommended.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the TB screening was not done.
Select record the date of the TB screening.

fields.toaster_info_text: Treat according to local protocol and/or refer for treatment.

fields.label: Other test
fields.label_info_text: If any other test was done that is not included here, add it here.

v_required.err: Input the name of other test(s) that were done.
Input the date of other test(s) that were done.
Input the result from the test(s).
